resources.string: PLEASE PROVIDE THE FOLLOWING DETAILS TO INITIALIZE THE APPLICATION. IF YOU SKIP THIS STEP, DEFAULT VALUES WILL BE USED FOR CLASS TIMINGS.\nPLEASE SPEND SOME TIME TO INITIALIZE THE APPLICATION.

GTAcampuSv1.1 consists of features like alerts, time-table of classes, notes, convertor and calculator.
 
INITIALIZE
 	On installing the application you will be requested to initialize the application. The values you enter can't be changed later unless you re-install the application. You will be asked to set the master password also which should not be forgotten, if you forget the password then you need to re-install the application and set the password again in order to access administrator features.
 

MENU ITEMS 
 1. EXIT
 	On clicking on this menu item you will be able to exit the application
 
 2. BACKUP
 	This menu feature helps you to backup the whole database of your application so that you will be able to restore your alerts, courses and notes. Backup will be made in your SD card as a folder named 'GTAcampuS'. The files in that folder should not be deleted/edited.
 
 3. RESTORE
 	This menu feature restores the application which restores the deleted alerts, courses and notes if you have a backup in your SD card. If the backup folder in your SD card is corrupted by any external activities, the application will fail to restore the database successfully. On restoring you will lost all the current data except notes. If you had initialized your application with different timings than in the backup made, on restoring the timings will be changed to that given in the backup image.
 
 4. SETTINGS
 	This menu feature includes options to turn on/off course alerts, notifications and also an option to change your master password. You can also set how much time before the course time you need to get alert, the snooze-timeout for course alerts and also interval length which will help you to avoid getting alerts for classes following breaks with the entered duration. Application will skip alerting for the course only if you hadn't bunked the previous class.
 
If you are stopping course alerts pressing the 'On the way' button of course alert window, then application will turn off the volumes of your device and also will turn off the course alerts by itself so that your device won't make any disturbances in class. After the class-time application itself will set back the device sounds to maximum and will turn on the course alerts.



ALERTS
 	You can set custom tasks / alarms in addition to the course alerts which are set by default on entering the course details. If you want to update any options of alerts like snooze time-out, math-mode, shake-mode, enable/disable etc., you can get the options window of the alert by clicking on the respective alert, in case of course alerts go to settings menu. On launching the alerts the alarm tone start from a low volume which will increase gradually to the maximum. If the alarm volume is set at level 1 then application won't increase the volume of alarm and will alert in the same volume until user input is received.
 
SHAKE MODE
 	If you set this mode enabled, then you will be able to snooze your alarm by just shaking the device
 
MATH MODE
 	If this mode is set enabled, on stopping an alert application will put up a single digit multiplication problem and you need to solve the problem correctly in order to stop the alert
 
CUSTOM TASKS
 	If you set a task with a past time, you won't get alert ever even though the alert is enabled. An alert of type 'task' will be automatically disabled on launching the alert, so if you need to set an alert again with the same task item, you need to re-enable the alert, else you won't get the alert.
 

TIME TABLE
 	This consists of the full view of your weekly class hours. Free hours are represented by a '-' symbol which will be replaced by course names on adding a course. The no:of hours is set on initializing the application which can't be changed later. You can see the course details and bunk count by a long click on the corresponding course.
 

COURSES
 	In the course tab you will be able to add courses. Here you will have to enter the course name, code and teacher's name which can't be edited later. In the time-table view courses will appear in the corresponding timings you enter here.
 

NOTES
 	Using this option you can make short notes or memos which can be read later. You will be able to edit the note later by a long click on the respective note.
 

BUNK-O-METER
 	Bunk-O-Meter stores your bunk statistics. It will display the course name as well as the no:of classes bunked. If you click on the respective course you will be able to see the date and the system time at which you added the bunk to the course. If you just want to add a bunk to a course, you can increment bunk count to a course by a long click on the respective course.
 

CONVERTOR
 	This tool helps you to convert values from one unit to other. You can select the main section in the drop-down menu on top and the units to be converted in the drop-down menu in the bottom. Convertor will automatically put results at the moment you press the done button of the virtual keyboard. If the results are big numbers it will come in the exponent format (base E power).
 

CALCULATOR
 	This calculator can deal calculations with very big digits. If the results are big numbers it will come in the exponent format (base E power). The final result will be toasted also. The calculator also includes options for finding GCD(Greatest Common Divisor - HCF) and LCM(Least Common Multiple).
 

MESSAGE
 	This can be used for passing some important informations as group messages which will be helpful especially for teachers or class leaders. A server is to be configured first with the GTAcampuS web-services and database file(available @ http://goo.gl/4Vklkg or in the github repo). The messages will be passed to all those who having their application configured to the same server location.
Enter the no: of class hours in a day \t
ADD ALL THE REGISTERED COURSES HERE
Set how much minutes before the class time you need to get alert
Turn off this option if you don\'t want notifications
Turn off this option if you don\'t want alerts for courses
Check this option to stop the alarm by solving a math problem
Check this option to snooze the alarm by shaking the device
Check this option to disable snooze option of alarm
Enter a title to be displayed
Application won\'t alert for courses after short breaks if previous class is not bunked
Enter the full path where you\'d hosted the application web-services
